Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been good, just busy with the documentary project.
That’s wonderful to hear! How is the documentary coming along?
It’s going well! I’ve started reaching out to people for interviews.
That’s fantastic! How has that process been for you?
It’s been a bit challenging, but also really rewarding. People are opening up to me.
That’s great to hear. What have you learned from those conversations so far?
I’ve learned that everyone has a unique story, and it’s important to listen without judgment.
That’s a valuable insight. How are you feeling about the emotional weight of those stories?
It’s heavy sometimes, but I feel honored to share their experiences.
That’s a beautiful perspective. Have you found any coping strategies for handling that emotional weight?
I’ve been journaling about my feelings after the interviews. It helps me process everything.
That’s a great way to reflect. How has journaling impacted your emotional state?
It’s helped me feel less overwhelmed and more connected to the project.
That’s wonderful to hear. What do you hope to achieve with this documentary?
I hope to raise awareness and encourage empathy towards those experiencing homelessness.
That’s a noble goal. How do you plan to share the final product?
I want to screen it at local community centers and possibly submit it to film festivals.
Those sound like excellent avenues for sharing your work. Have you thought about how to promote it?
I’ve been considering social media and local news outlets to get the word out.
That’s a smart approach. Have you used social media for your previous projects?
A little, but I think I need to be more strategic this time.
It can definitely help to have a clear plan for promotion. Would you like to brainstorm some ideas?
Yes, I’d love that!
Great! What platforms do you think would be most effective for your audience?
I think Instagram and Facebook would work well, maybe even a dedicated website.
Those are solid choices. You could share behind-the-scenes content to engage your audience.
That’s a good idea! People love seeing the process.
Absolutely! It can help build excitement for the final product.
I’ll start planning some content for those platforms.
That sounds like a great next step. How are you managing your time with this project and family life?
I’ve been trying to stick to my work hours, but it’s still a challenge.
Balancing everything can be tough. Have you been able to implement any of the rituals we discussed?
Yes, I’ve been taking that walk after work, and it helps me unwind.
That’s wonderful! It’s great to hear you’re finding ways to create that separation.
It really makes a difference in my mood.
I’m glad to hear that. How is your daughter doing with everything?
She’s doing well! I’ve been spending more quality time with her, and it’s been nice.
That’s fantastic! What activities have you been doing together?
We’ve been going to the park and doing arts and crafts at home.
Those sound like fun bonding activities! How does she respond to the time you spend together?
She loves it! She’s always asking when we can do our next project.
That’s heartwarming to hear. It seems like you’re nurturing a strong relationship with her.
I hope so! I really want her to feel valued and heard.
You’re doing a great job at that. What other goals do you have for your family life?
I want to continue being present and supportive, especially as she grows older.
That’s an admirable goal. How do you plan to maintain that presence?
I think I need to keep prioritizing our time together and being mindful of distractions.
That’s a great insight. Setting boundaries with technology can help with that.
Yes, I completely agree. I want to lead by example.
That’s a wonderful approach. As we wrap up today, what would you like to focus on for our next session?
I’d like to discuss how the documentary is progressing and any challenges I might face.
That sounds like a solid plan. I look forward to hearing more about it.
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! See you next time.
Bye!
Bye!
